keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject

lead_paragraph: The Colombian government is expected to sign a final peace agreement with FARC guerrillas by March 23, bringing an end to the longest civil war in Latin America.

headline.print_headline: Obama Lauds Colombia for Pursuing Peace With Rebels and Seeks Big Aid Increase
headline.main: Obama Praises Colombia’s Peace Efforts With Rebels and Seeks Big Aid Increase

snippet: The Colombian government is expected to sign a final peace agreement with FARC guerrillas by March 23, bringing an end to the longest civil war in Latin America.
abstract: Colombian Pres Juan Manuel Santos joins Pres Obama at White House to celebrate victory over Colombia's drug cartels and  imminent peace agreement with FARC rebels; United States contributed $10 billion to 15-year campaign, effort some criticize as excessively militaristic and secret.
